meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jason Parker Elizabeth McCullough Mike Lewis Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6617.

td.p: Jason Parker, an electrical engineer from Spring, Texas
Elizabeth McCullough, a freelance researcher and administrative assistant from Lowell, Massachusetts
Mike Lewis, a systems engineer from Bloomington, Minnesota (whose 3-day cash winnings total $92,401)

tr.td: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
YOU PAID FOR THIS AD
FISH
DISENFRANCHISED
(Alex: We want you to name the city that lost a professional team.)
MISSION
"IM" POSSIBLE
(Alex: The "I-M" will come up at the end of each correct response.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_3', 'clue_J_3_3_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew is snorkeling in the water off Baja California, Mexico.) The black spots at the rear of the butterflyfish act as a decoy set of these organs. They trick predators into attacking the tail rather than the head, allowing the fish a better chance to get away.')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew is snorkeling in the water off Baja California, Mexico.) The black spots at the rear of the butterflyfish act as a decoy set of these organs. They trick predators into attacking the tail rather than the head, allowing the fish a better chance to get away.

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
